alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 1:22AM EDT until September 13 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Tuesday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, yards are flooded on Saint George Island, and water will begin covering the road leading to the island, especially if there is wave action. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. High tide at Coltons Point is at 4:49 AM and 5:11 PM, at Point Lookout 3:10 AM and 3:44 PM, and at Piney Point 4:13 AM and 4:35 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/04 AM 3.2 1.6 1.5 1.0 Minor 12/05 PM 3.2 1.6 1.5 1.0 Minor 13/04 AM 3.1 1.5 1.5 1.0 Minor 13/05 PM 2.9 1.3 1.2 1.0 None 14/04 AM 2.6 1.0 1.2 0.5 None 14/05 PM 2.6 1.0 1.0 0.5 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
